title: Structures of Belonging
summary: Essay for Aksioma's Postscriptum series that reimagines blockchains not as property infrastructure but as 'structures of belonging', foregrounding collaboration, co-ownership, and shared governance.

title: The Politics of Visual Indeterminacy in Abstract AI Art
summary: Leonardo journal essay examining Tom White’s AI-driven abstraction projects as a way to probe the politics of visual indeterminacy and the confidence of machine vision systems.

title: Tactical Entanglements: AI Art, Creative Agency, and the Limits of Intellectual Property
summary: Monograph with meson press developing the concept of posthumanist agential assemblages in AI art, critiquing anthropocentric authorship and IP while exploring tactical entanglements of aesthetics, law, and capital.

title: Survival Interventions in GTA & the Limits of Performance in Virtual Environments
summary: Article in Video Game Art Reader Vol. 2 analysing performance-based interventions in GTA as critical engagements with survival tropes in game worlds, drawing on performance art traditions.

title: Digital Art as ‘Monetised Graphics:’ Enforcing IP on the Blockchain
summary: Philosophy & Technology essay critiquing blockchain-based platforms like Monegraph as attempts to financialise digital art and reinforce IP-based enclosures.
